bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, October 29, 1900

div1.p: Reed is told to return to Washington, D.C. after the conference instead of returning directly to Cuba.

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, October 29, 1900
div1.opener:
October 20, 1900.
Major Walter Reed,
Surgeon, U. S. Army,
Washington, D. C.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Secretary of War directs, as necessary for the public
service, that, in complying with the requirements of paragraph
25, Special Orders, No. 266, October 19, 1900, from this office,
you return to this city. Instead of to your proper station in
Cuba, as directed in the order above cited.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Carter Assistant Adjutant General.
